gpkg 0.0.2.9001

Lazy Access to Table Information

Source: R/gpkg-lazy.frame.R
lazy.frame.Rd

lazy.frame(): Get information on a table in a GeoPackage (without returning the whole table).

dplyr.frame(): access a specific table (by name) and get a "lazy" tibble object referencing that table

lazy.frame(x, table_name = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for character
lazy.frame(x, table_name = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for geopackage
lazy.frame(x, table_name = NULL, ...)

dplyr.frame(x, table_name, ...)

# S3 method for character
dplyr.frame(x, table_name, ...)

# S3 method for geopackage
dplyr.frame(x, table_name, ...)

Arguments

x

A geopackage object or character path to GeoPcakge

table_name

One or more table names; for lazy.frame() if table_name=NULL returns a record for each table. dplyr.frame() requires table_name be specified

...

Additional arguments. In dplyr.frame() arguments in ... are passed to dplyr::tbl(). For lazy.frame(), ... arguments are (currently) not used.

Examples


tf <- tempfile(fileext = ".gpkg")

r <- terra::rast(system.file("extdata", "dem.tif", package = "gpkg"))

gpkg_write(r,
           destfile = tf,
           RASTER_TABLE = "DEM1",
           FIELD_NAME = "Elevation")

gpkg_write(r,
           destfile = tf,
           append = TRUE,
           RASTER_TABLE = "DEM2",
           FIELD_NAME = "Elevation")

g <- geopackage(tf)

# inspect gpkg_contents table
dplyr.frame(g, "gpkg_contents")
#> # Source:   table<gpkg_contents> [2 x 10]
#> # Database: sqlite 3.40.1 [/tmp/RtmpUMsB43/file19bf4ce4eb9.gpkg]
#>   table_name data_type    ident…¹ descr…² last_…³ min_x min_y max_x max_y srs_id
#>   <chr>      <chr>        <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <int>
#> 1 DEM1       2d-gridded-… DEM1    ""      2023-0…  6.01  49.7  6.27  49.9   4326
#> 2 DEM2       2d-gridded-… DEM2    ""      2023-0…  6.01  49.7  6.27  49.9   4326
#> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​identifier, ²​description, ³​last_change

# materialize a data.frame from gpkg_2d_gridded_tile_ancillary
library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)

dplyr.frame(g, "gpkg_2d_gridded_tile_ancillary") %>% 
  dplyr::filter(tpudt_name == "DEM2") %>% 
  dplyr::select(mean, std_dev) %>% 
  dplyr::collect()
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>    mean std_dev
#>   <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1  324.    58.5
